alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued December 07 at 3:35PM PST until December 09 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCHES ISSUED OVER PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... .Moderate to strong north to northeast winds combined with low relative humidities will elevate the risk for extreme fire behavior if a new fire starts. The winds and risk will be focused over Santa Barbara County later Friday and Friday night, then shift to Los Angeles and Ventura Counties on Saturday and Sunday. The decision on whether or not to upgrade these watches to Red Flag Warnings will be made on Friday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SANTA BARBARA COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Friday afternoon through late Friday night. * WINDS...North to northeast winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph. Strongest in the mountains and foothills. Isolated gusts to 55 mph possible in the windiest locations. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimums 5 to 15 percent common. Poor overnight recoveries of 25 to 40 percent. Driest in the mountains and foothills. * IMPACTS...If fire ignition occurs, conditions may be favorable for extreme fire behavior which would threaten life and property. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Stronger winds are expected tonight, but humidities will be elevated.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are likely to occur in the coming days. Residents near wildland interfaces should prepare now on what to do if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information..
